RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHENANDOAH CAT pressured the pace and contested even terms two deep on the turn, dug in for the advantage leaving the sixteenth pole and edged clear later yards. HANDSOME JOANIE gave close chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn and dug in to take second in the final strides. YESSIROFFICER took the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, contested even terms nearest the rail on the turn, was caught mid-stretch, flattened later yards and just lasted for third. CHURCH KEY gave chase toward the inside, rounded the turn off the rail, dug in to finish well and just missed third. GOLD PHOENIX chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and finished evenly to close the gap. A BLONDE THING angled to the outside and gave chase, raced in the four path of the turn, moved again to the outside leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. TINA'S SONG saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Yessirofficer
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,even terms rail turn,caught 1/16,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Shenandoah Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,edge clear later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Church Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, off rail turn,dug in lane,finished well,just missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Handsome Joanie
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,4p turn,dug in lane,up 2nd final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POSTED took a quick lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, cleared Spectaculo passing the quarter and was steadily handled to hold on well. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn in the two and three paths, dug in from the head of the lane and took the nod for second under the wire. HERETODAYGONMANANA settled off the pace toward the inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was nipped from second under the wire. SPECTACULO stalked from the three path, challenged nearing the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back past the quarter, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. MASTER YOO rounded the opening turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, ran at the rail on the far turn, his rider lost his whip leaving the eighth pole and showed little more. AIR MEDAL was not a factor. PONTICELLO was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ponticello
ENTRY.OWNER: Sperling Nancie S and Racanelli Mark Joseph

ENTRY.NAME: Heretodaygonmanana
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,nipped 2nd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOTIVATED SPEAKER gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the six path, left the turn widest and dug in to get up the final strides. RUNAWAY ROAD accelerated to the front leaving the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn near the rail, was steadily handled through the lane but was caught flattening the final strides. MY SLICK NICK chased the pace and raced in the three path of the turn, eased five wide into the stretch and while outfinished for the win, was gaining on the runner-up. FLASH OF DAY chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. GEM DANCER pressured the pace leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the turn then flattened in the lane. TRICKY STRONG gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. FROSTY THE BULL pressured the pace from the three eighths pole but dropped back toward the quarter pole and weakened. CHASIN CHAPIN gave chase inside then weakened at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Runaway Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught flattening late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOME IS NINE took over while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, was urged away from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled through the stretch. MIZZEN saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. AWESOME INCENTIVE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. ROSELEE stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn then flattened in the lane. MISS COREY raced boxed at the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the half mile pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. PRACTICALLY THERE saved ground. CODAS HONOR never factored and raced in the three path of the far turn. HELLUVA LADY rounded the opening turn about the five path, faded leaving the turn and was eased into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Corey
ENTRY.COMMENT: boxed rail 1st turn,chased 1/2,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Roselee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKINLIMMARGARITAS took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, widened at the rail on the far turn, was steadily handled through the upper stretch then taken in hand later yards. JUBASLILBALLERINA chased the pace, raced in the three path on the turn, cleared second inside the sixteenth pole and finished well. OUR GREAT NOTION gave close chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. CARMELIZED gave close early chase but dropped back between horses mid turn and flattened in the lane. SMOKIN LADY pressured the early pace inside but dropped back leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. LOVE OF GRACE chased toward the inside, raced near the rail most of the turn but angled out toward the head of the lane and flattened stride. GREY FLAMINGO gave chase inside and was not a factor. S S FOUR QUEENS gave chase outside and was not a factor. STOWE PATROL gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path. S S CASINO GIRL saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Love of Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, rail turn,angled out near 1/8,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,widened rail turn,in hand later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 16, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOADED SNIPER dueled for the lead three wide at the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace from that point, raced clear in the three path midway on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. ALWAYS DRINKING chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, drifted leaving the turn then cleared second late yards. TOLLER chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and came along for third late yards. WIZARD OF ODDS chased outside, raced in the five and six paths of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. IMPETUOUS pressured the pace from the three eighths pole, dropped back leaving the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. STAR LUCK chased through the backstretch, raced in the three and four paths of the turn and showed little in the lane. MISCHIEVOUS JESSE pressured the pace from the three eighths pole but dropped back leaving the quarter pole, showed no response in the lane and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Always Drinking
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mischievous Jesse
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early pace,dropped back 1/4,no response,vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Loaded Sniper
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 3wd 3/8,set pressured pace,clear mid turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowan ces).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOBI WAN KENOBI settled back inside on the first turn, started a bid leaving the half mile pole and progressed steadily from that point, raced at the rail on the far turn, took the lead passing the eighth pole and held well with steady handling. XANTHE saved ground on the first turn, raced hemmed in leaving the seven sixteenths pole but bid toward the three eighths, contested at a close disadvantage in the four path of the far turn, cleared second mid-stretch and finished well. NO LOVE FOR JUBA rounded the opening turn in the five path, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the four and five paths of the far turn and came along to take third later yards. RUNALDO was squeezed at the break then stalked from the two and three paths, challenged at the three eighths pole and raced close in the three path of the far turn, but drifted leaving the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. LITTLE ROO ROO raced with the early pace and took the lead at the nine sixteenths pole, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, contested the edge off the rail on the far turn, was caught passing the eighth pole and flattened in the lane. NEVERPOPTHECORK broke out and made contact with Runaldo leaving the gate and settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened in the five path of the far turn. MISSIONARY broke in and made contact with Runaldo leaving the gate then set the early pace inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase from that point but faded through the backstretch. PINNACLE REEF raced off the pace in the three and four paths the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Tobi Wan Kenobi
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,bid leaving 1/2,long steady gain,up past 1/8,drvng

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DECISIVE CAUSE rounded the opening turn in the six path and started an outside bid into the backstretch, raced close off the rail through the far turn, dug in to take the lead in later yards and ran clear nearing the wire. KOBE'S GIRL took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, was steadily handled leaving the turn but was met, and relented in later yards. VICTORY ROYALE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and just lasted for third. BOCA BIRDIE saved ground well off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and steadily improved at the rail on the far turn, steadied in tight quarters at the rail nearing mid-stretch, though, finished evenly. CHANNEL SCENT raced well back saving ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out nearing the head of the lane, but lugged in under right hand encouragement and steadied nearing mid-stretch. EXCUSES EXCUSES rated close inside, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. LOVE TO ZOOM rounded the opening turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole then weakened in the four path of the far turn. WALK A FINE LINE raced in the seven path the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response. DYLADDIE raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. CAN I GET AN AMEN became fractious in the gate, raced in the five path on the first turn and left the turn toward the outside, showed little response through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter.

ENTRY.NAME: Boca Birdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail far turn,in tight near 1/16,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Excuses Excuses
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased past 7/16,rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Victory Royale
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,dug in lane,just held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Kobe's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,met late,relented

ENTRY.NAME: Channel Scent
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,chased 7/16,rail far turn,eased out,lugged in

ENTRY.NAME: Dyladdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased past 7/16,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Decisive Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6p 1st turn,outside bid 1/2,close far turn,up late,clear wire
